EngineeringPhilosophy.title: My Engineering Philosophy
EngineeringPhilosophy.subtitle: Engineering with empathy, efficiency, and thoughtful automation—because great software isn't just about shipping features; it's about empowering the people who build them.
EngineeringPhilosophy.radicalEmpathyDescription: I foster trust through open communication, making it safe to ask questions, raise concerns, and collaborate deeply.
EngineeringPhilosophy.developerExperienceDescription: Efficient tools and workflows minimize wasted time, boost morale, and let engineers focus on meaningful work.
EngineeringPhilosophy.ownershipWithGenerosityDescription: When something breaks, we fix it together—no finger-pointing. Sharing credit and lessons strengthens the whole team.
EngineeringPhilosophy.technicalForesightDescription: Well-designed guardrails and flexible architecture allow growth without accumulating tomorrow's tech debt.
EngineeringPhilosophy.relentlessAutomationDescription: Automate the boring, enforce standards in CI/CD pipelines, and let humans innovate where it matters most.
EngineeringPhilosophy.transparentCommunicationDescription: Frequent, open updates keep teams aligned. More clarity upfront prevents fire drills later.
EngineeringPhilosophy.mentorshipDescription: A mentor's success is measured by their mentees' growth. Empower peers to speak up, challenge ideas, and own their craft.
EngineeringPhilosophy.kindnessDescription: Feedback should guide, not criticize. Code reviews are for team growth, not personal attacks.

PreferredTechStack.title: Tech Stack I Love Working With
PreferredTechStack.subtitle: Technologies I prefer and frequently use in my projects.
PreferredTechStack.reactDescription: I enjoy React for its flexibility—whether building simple components or architecting complex applications, it adapts to the project's needs. Its component-based approach and rich ecosystem make it one of my favorite front-end tools.
PreferredTechStack.nextjsDescription: Next.js is an incredible tool with powerful out-of-the-box features. The built-in optimizations and Vercel integration make it a strong choice for modern applications.
PreferredTechStack.angularDescription: As my career has progressed, I've found myself gravitating toward opinionated frameworks like Angular. Its structured approach, dependency injection, and built-in state management make it a solid choice for enterprise-grade applications.
PreferredTechStack.nestjsDescription: I've used Express, Java/Spring, and C#/Dotnet, and NestJS really stands out. It bridges the Inversion of Control (IoC) gap while keeping everything in TypeScript, making full-stack development seamless.
PreferredTechStack.dotnetCoreDescription: .NET Core is a powerhouse for backend development. Its performance, flexibility, and strong C# ecosystem make it one of my go-to choices for building scalable, maintainable APIs. Microsoft's modern improvements have made .NET more developer-friendly than ever.
PreferredTechStack.typescriptDescription: Once you use TypeScript, it's hard to go back. It provides strong typing without getting in the way, making large codebases more maintainable and reducing runtime errors.
PreferredTechStack.ormDescription: I see the ORM vs. sprocs debate, but for most applications, ORMs are the way to go. I enjoy the fast-paced world of feature development more than shaving microseconds off queries. That said, I can work with both approaches.
PreferredTechStack.cloudDescription: I’ve worked with AWS, Azure, and GCP—each has its quirks. What I don't enjoy? On-prem. While it makes sense at scale, the developer experience is usually far worse than working in the cloud.
